newsitem.title: USA: CAM cites costs, investment for lower Q2.
newsitem.headline: CAM cites costs, investment for lower Q2.

text.p: CAM Data Systems Inc Thursday blamed rising costs and internal investment for second quarter revenues and earnings that fell below the year-ago results.

In a statement, the company said developing, installing and servicing computer networks has been more expansive than expected from the move toward open systems and new software versus older terminal-based systems.
Moreover, the company has been spending heavily on its next generation of software products.
"These factors, combined with substantial investments in internal automation, have negatively impacted our profitability in 1997," Geoff Knapp, chief executive, said. Knapp added
sales increases that had been expected will not be realized until CAM Data can deliver more new products.
Earlier, the company reported net income of $9,500, or nil per share in its fiscal third quarter ended June 30, versus a profit of $287,800, or $0.13 a share one year ago.

Third quarter revenues fell to $4.4 million compared to $4.7 million in 1996's third quarter. For the nine months of fiscal 1997, sales rose 12 percent to $12.8 million, but earnings fell to $0.07 per share from $0.28 per share.
